intro: Fissistigma schefferi, commonly known as the Scheffers' lily, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features strap-like, grassy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Fissistigma schefferi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
